entry.title: Nintendo: Mario and his Mushroom Kingdom hopping into theme parks
entry.summary:
"We've come to the point where the kids who grew up playing Nintendo games are now parents who have their own kids," said the veteran game designer during an interview translated by Bill Trinen, product marketing director at Nintendo of America.

Nintendo Co. announced plans last month for immersive experiences featuring the Japanese gaming giant's characters at Universal theme parks, but it didn't provide any details.

He noted Nintendo has been working closely with the theme park behemoth on the project.

"For me, because it's Mr. Miyamoto, I want him to continue making things as long as he wants to continue making things," said Shinya Takahashi, general manager of the software planning and development division at Kyoto, Japan-based Nintendo.

Nintendo is celebrating the 30th anniversary of its groundbreaking platformer "Super Mario Bros." throughout the year, culminating with the Sept.

entry.title: Will 'Call of Duty: Black Ops 3' Be Held Back By Xbox 360 And PS3?
entry.summary: "However, we know that there are still some fans that haven't made the transition to the new console hardware, which is why we're happy to share that we're working with developers Beenox and Mercenary Technology on Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3."

entry.title: 'Call of Duty: Black Ops 3' coming to PS3, Xbox 360
entry.summary: Activision has announced that the upcoming Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 will be available for Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 and not only for Xbox One, PlayStation 4 and PC as previously announced.

entry.title: Woman pleads not guilty to fatally stabbing beau over Xbox
Woman pleads not guilty to fatally stabbing beau over Xbox
entry.summary:
NEWARK, N.J. (AP) - A New Jersey woman accused of fatally stabbing her boyfriend during a dispute over their Xbox console has pleaded not guilty to aggravated manslaughter.

According to police reports, the couple began arguing over Xbox and the dispute turned physical.
